intro: Argyrolobium abyssinicum var. caespitosum, commonly known as the Abyssinian silverlobed burr veldt, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, rounded leaves and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
